title: Welcome to tidepredictor
text:
Welcome to tidepredictor

See more in Getting started
A complete reference is available here

title: API Reference
text:
UtideAdapter
Adapter for the utide tide predictor engine.


NetCDFConstituentRepository
A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.

title: API Reference
text:
UtideAdapter
Adapter for the utide tide predictor engine.


NetCDFConstituentRepository
A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.

title: NetCDFConstituentRepository
text:

A repository of tidal constituents stored in a NetCDF file.

Get the current constituents for a given longitude and latitude.

title: UtideAdapter
text:

Adapter for the utide tide predictor engine.











Name
Type
Description
Default

ConstituentRepository
Repository
required

PredictionType
The type of prediction to make.

Name
Description




predict
Predict tide levels or currents using utide.





UtideAdapter.predict(lon, lat, start, end, interval=timedelta(hours=1))
Predict tide levels or currents using utide.











Name
Type

Default




lon
float
The longitude.

The latitude.

The interval between predictions.
timedelta(hours=1)









Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
The predicted tide levels or currents.






The workhorse of this functions the reconstruct function from UTide

title: Getting started
text:
Install the tidepredictor package from the distributed wheel file.

pip install tidepredictor-*.whl

Copy constituent files (.nc files) to the ~/.local/share/tidepredictor directory.

title: Getting started
text:
Install the tidepredictor package from the distributed wheel file.

pip install tidepredictor-*.whl

Copy constituent files (.nc files) to the ~/.local/share/tidepredictor directory.

title: Getting started
text:
Usage
tidepredictor can be used either as a command line tool or as a Python library.

Command line

!tidepredictor -x 15.0 -y 58.0 -s "2024-01-01" -e "2024-01-01 06:00:00" -i 30

time,level
2024-01-01T00:00:00Z,-0.230
2024-01-01T00:30:00Z,-0.255
2024-01-01T01:00:00Z,-0.255
2024-01-01T01:30:00Z,-0.232
2024-01-01T02:00:00Z,-0.187
2024-01-01T02:30:00Z,-0.126
2024-01-01T03:00:00Z,-0.052
2024-01-01T03:30:00Z,0.029
2024-01-01T04:00:00Z,0.110
2024-01-01T04:30:00Z,0.186
2024-01-01T05:00:00Z,0.251
2024-01-01T05:30:00Z,0.302
2024-01-01T06:00:00Z,0.333



All options are available as command line arguments.

!tidepredictor --help

                                                                                
 Usage: tidepredictor [OPTIONS]                                                 
                                                                                
 Predict the tides for a given location.                                        
                                                                                
╭─ Options ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│ *  --lon                 -x      FLOAT RANGE           Longitude             │
│                                  [-180<=x<=180]        [default: None]       │
│                                                        [required]            │
│ *  --lat                 -y      FLOAT RANGE           Latitude              │
│                                  [-90<=x<=90]          [default: None]       │
│                                                        [required]            │
│    --start               -s      [%Y-%m-%d|%Y-%m-%dT%  Start date            │
│                                  H:%M:%S|%Y-%m-%d      [default: None]       │
│                                  %H:%M:%S]                                   │
│    --end                 -e      [%Y-%m-%d|%Y-%m-%dT%  End date              │
│                                  H:%M:%S|%Y-%m-%d      [default: None]       │
│                                  %H:%M:%S]                                   │
│    --interval            -i      INTEGER RANGE [x>=1]  Interval in minutes   │
│                                                        [default: 30]         │
│    --output              -o      PATH                  Output file, default  │
│                                                        is stdout             │
│                                                        [default: None]       │
│    --format                      [csv|json]            Output format         │
│                                                        [default: csv]        │
│    --type                        [level|current]       Type of prediction,   │
│                                                        level or u,v          │
│                                                        [default: level]      │
│    --precision           -p      INTEGER RANGE [x>=0]  Number of decimal     │
│                                                        places. (csv only)    │
│                                                        [default: 3]          │
│    --install-completion                                Install completion    │
│                                                        for the current       │
│                                                        shell.                │
│    --show-completion                                   Show completion for   │
│                                                        the current shell, to │
│                                                        copy it or customize  │
│                                                        the installation.     │
│    --help                                              Show this message and │
│                                                        exit.                 │
╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯





Python library

from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime
from tidepredictor import UtideAdapter, PredictionType, NetCDFConstituentRepository

DATA_DIR = Path("~/.local/share/tidepredictor")
path = (DATA_DIR / "level.nc").expanduser()

repo = NetCDFConstituentRepository(path)

predictor = UtideAdapter(repo, type=PredictionType.level)

df = predictor.predict(
    lon=0.0,
    lat=0.0,
    start=datetime(2021, 1, 1),
    end=datetime(2021, 1, 2),
)
df.head()


shape: (5, 2)



time
level


datetime[ns]
f64

-0.312357

0.53892
